title: Inspiration runes = Trash
body:
Magical footwear was the only decent rune and that was nerfed into a more snowball heavy rune than it was before. Let's look at the runes.

Futures market: Can loan (not even on your first buy, but after 2 minutes) 150 gold or so, upgrading to about 300-350 after 30 minutes
compared to triumph, which gives 20 gold per kill/assist (easily 300 gold) + 12% missing health to save you or give sustain. Yeah and don't forget using debt costs 50 gold a use. 

biscuits: nerfed into trash, if you think they're still good you're delusional

minion dematerializer: nerfed from 6 to 3, it's trash

Stopwatch: very niche, situational, and the item itself is bullshit, legit useless vs most champs, overpowered vs select few

hexflash: Are you trolling?

Cosmic insight/Time warptonic/ approach velocity: The only good runes in the entire tree and they're all on the same rune set so you can't actually use them in combination with each other. 

The keystones

Unsealed spellbook: Enjoy the loss scrub
Kleptomancy: Are you ezreal? Viktor? Some bullshit ranged top laner? Then you're trolling hard
Glacial augment: Are you an ap champion building very specific items to abuse this? There are still better options but it's viable otherwise you're trolling


Like riot, cmon man! This spell tree could be completely removed from the game and almost nobody would notice, and if they did they would find a replacement in seconds

Im talking like somewhere between 400-500 hp at max level while going resolve primary would only net you around 250 or something, it was a good way to get a lot of a stat that you wanted, especially if you chose it as primary.

Inspiration was nerfed a couple more times, in more relevant ways. The runes were re-arranged in less optimal tiers, so that the best combinations were not possible. Actually, inspiration has probably been nerfed more than any other tree. Originally, TWT was a trait of taking Inspiration in the first place! Biscuits have been changed a couple times.  OP kind of has a point - the tree is advanced, and much stronger in high MMR. In low MMR, partly because players aren't as efficient with gold, and partly because the game goes on longer, Inspiration becomes worse, indeed to the point of trolling at times. Unsealed Spellbook is particularly sophisticated.

In low MMR, unless Inspiration is an obvious choice for some reason, probably better to go with something simpler, or scaling. If you're good enough to use Inspiration properly in low MMR, then you're probably good enough to get gold that others are missing, and instead take scaling runes.

Which is basically what OP was saying.

No wonder you lost that game as Nasus if you think inspiration is bad.

Spellbook is immense versatility. Like do you realize just how much Nasus wants to be able to have Ghost, TP, *and* Flash? Spellbook is how you actually get all of those. Getting to use Clarity in lane is immense as well, since it's a lot more sustain and poke before you have to back. Then you can have cleanse, or exhaust, or ignite. Most importantly, it lets you have a second smite, which is absolutely massive for baron and dragon fights, especially since it's on a champion that's hard as hell to kill.

Biscuits are great as hell as well. Again, a lot more time in lane.

And for the ones that Nasus shouldn't always be using that you still dissed:

Market - Strong on a lot of supports, since their builds don't cost that much and it can give you other components you'd need much faster.

Dematerializer - Not sure on this one, but it used to be pretty important for a few champions, since it'd affect how fast it took for them to be able to clear the wave in one spell. Still probably okay as a crutch for some champions that struggle to actually kill cannon.

Stopwatch is hardly that situational. At the worst it's gold towards Zhonya's/GA/Stoneplate, and it often can be just enough to save you from a last tick of ignite or a tower shot.

Hexflash *is* situational, however. Can work well on Blitz and Leona, and I think Rengar can use it for a range extension on passive. Far from garbage, but it's not really usable on most champions.

Nimbus Cloak is like a keystone for some champions; for others it's almost completely pointless.

T3 is usually good free stats. In general, Sorcery is a "statty" tree. (Or "stat-checky")

T4 - again, these are strong ... when you compare HOW much you are getting from Sorcery in T3 or T4...

T3 in Domination needs to be stacked in ways that are by no means certain, for a maximum of 18AD. T3 and T4 in Sorcery contains Runes worth a lot more than that, and they don't require stacking, or else they stack by themselves. Depending on the champion, Transcendence can be played for over 100 AD. Even a single stack will give 12 AD. And by 20m, the value of Gathering Storm has surpassed all of those T3 Domination Runes. Just for staying in the game. Not even a single takedown.

Not knocking the Domination Runes. Some are quite strong. Sorcery has some runes that can be pushed farther..

Again... OP comes down on Stopwatch. Well... if you KNOW that you'll be building a GA anyway, then stopwatch makes a lot of sense. That would make it a very valuable rune. Matches were you are playing a carry or hypercarry, matches where you are vs a champion with Ult/Execute reset mechanics. But in low MMR, again, the GA is not as good an item, your teammates won't ensure your revival etc... so Stopwatch value becomes elusive...

Mages who almost always build Zhonyas, on the other hand, really do want the stopwatch. But, if rune in another tree will make you strong enough to get a couple early kills... experience would teach to avoid Inspiration. In high MMR, and pro play especially, where early kills are infrequent, then the Stopwatch becomes more attractive.

This is the same argument regarding Cleanse summ. I know that I'll need either Cleanse or a QSS in a particular match. (And my champion uses Mercurial decently.) I could take Cleanse and save the gold. Or I could take Ignite or Exhaust and get a couple early kill that would pay for the QSS (which has a shorter CD besides).

I can't remember the last time I saw an Inspiration keystone other than Klepto (on Ez of course) in a high-level match. They seem extremely niche compared to straightforward damage/defense boosts like Electrocute or Aftershock.
